channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Generalization of some of Ramanujan's formulae
item.description: arXiv:2408.09077v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We shall make use of the method of partial fractions to generalize some of Ramanujan's infinite series identities, including Ramanujan's famous formula for $\zeta(2n+1)$, and we shall also give a generalization of the transformation formula for the Dedekind eta function. It is shown here that the method of partial fractions can be used to obtain many similar identities of this kind.
item.dc:creator: Aung Phone Maw

item.title: $\sigma$-Sets and $\sigma$-Antisets
item.description: arXiv:2501.00047v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we present a brief study of the $\sigma$-set-$\sigma$-antiset duality that occurs in $\sigma$-set theory and we also present the development of the integer space $3^{A}=\left\langle 2^{A}, 2^{A^{-}} \right\rangle$ for the cardinals $|A|=2,3$ together with its algebraic properties. In this article, we also develop a presentation of some of the properties of fusion of $\sigma$-sets and finally we present the development and definition of a type of equations of one $\sigma$-set variable.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Gatica, Alfonso Bustamente
